title: iNaturalist Organism Interaction Demonstration
description: Demonstration extract from iNaturalist research grade records from Project 18530 with organism interactions.

fields.name: agentID
fields.title: Agent ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dcterms:Agent.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: agentType
fields.title: Agent Type
fields.description: A category that best matches the nature of a dcterms:Agent.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: preferredAgentName
fields.title: Preferred Agent Name
fields.description: A name of a dcterms:Agent preferred in searches and results.
fields.rdfs:comment: A name given to the resource.

fields.name: agentRemarks
fields.title: Agent Remarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a dcterms:Agent.

fields.name: eventID
fields.title: Event ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for the set of information associated with a dwc:Event (something that occurs at a place and time). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

fields.name: parentEventID
fields.title: Parent Event ID
fields.description: An identifier for a broader dwc:Event that contains this and potentially other dwc:Events.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.examples: `A1` (parentEventID to identify the main Whittaker Plot in nested samples, each with its own eventID - `A1:1`, `A1:2`).
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for the broader dwc:Event that groups this and potentially other dwc:Events.

fields.name: preferredEventName
fields.title: Preferred Event Name
fields.description: The name of a dwc:Event preferred in searches and results.
fields.rdfs:comment: A name given to the resource.

fields.name: eventCategory
fields.title: Event Category
fields.description: A broad category that best matches the nature of a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a limited, tightly controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: eventType
fields.title: Event Type
fields.description: A narrow category that best matches the nature of a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.rdfs:comment: The nature of the dwc:Event.

fields.name: datasetName
fields.title: Dataset Name
fields.description: A name of a source dataset.
fields.rdfs:comment: The name identifying the data set from which the record was derived.

fields.name: datasetID
fields.title: Dataset ID
fields.description: An identifier for a source dataset.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for the set of data. May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to a collection or institution.

fields.name: fieldNumber
fields.title: Field Number
fields.description: An identifier given to a dwc:Event in the field.
fields.comments: Often serves as a link between field notes and a dwc:Event. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier given to the dwc:Event in the field. Often serves as a link between field notes and the dwc:Event.

fields.name: eventConductedBy
fields.title: Event Conducted By
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of dcterms:Agents responsible for conducting or recording a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `Jos√© E. Crespo`; `Oliver P. Pearson | Anita K. Pearson`; `FMNH`
fields.rdfs:comment: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations responsible for recording the original dwc:Occurrence. The primary collector or observer, especially one who applies a personal identifier (dwc:recordNumber), should be listed first.

fields.name: eventConductedByID
fields.title: Event Conducted By ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dcterms:Agent responsible for conducting or recording a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.rdfs:comment: A list (concatenated and separated) of the globally unique identifier for the person, people, groups, or organizations responsible for recording the original dwc:Occurrence.

fields.name: eventDate
fields.title: Event Date
fields.description: A date-time or time interval during which a dwc:Event occurred.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019. Not suitable for a time in a geological context.
fields.examples: `1963-03-08T14:07-06:00` (8 Mar 1963 at or after 2:07pm and before 2:08pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC); `2009-02-20T08:40Z` (20 February 2009 at or after 8:40am and before 8:41 UTC); `2018-08-29T15:19` (29 August 2018 at or after 3:19pm and before 3:20pm local time); `1809-02-12` (within the day 12 February 1809); `1906-06` (in the month of June 1906); `1971` (in the year 1971); `2007-03-01T13:00:00Z/2008-05-11T15:30:00Z` (some time within the interval beginning 1 March 2007 at 1pm UTC and before 11 May 2008 at 3:30pm UTC); `1900/1909` (some time within the interval between the beginning of the year 1900 and before the year 1909); `2007-11-13/15` (some time in the interval between the beginning of 13 November 2007 and before 15 November 2007)
fields.rdfs:comment: The date-time or interval during which a dwc:Event occurred. For occurrences, this is the date-time when the dwc:Event was recorded. Not suitable for a time in a geological context.

fields.name: eventTime
fields.title: Event Time
fields.description: The time or interval during which a dwc:Event occurred.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a time of day that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.
fields.examples: `14:07-06:00` (at or after 2:07pm and before 2:08pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC); `08:40:21Z` (at or after 8:40:21am and before 8:41:22am UTC); `13:00:00Z/15:30:00Z` (at or after 1pm and before 3:30pm UTC)
fields.rdfs:comment: The time or interval during which a dwc:Event occurred.

fields.name: startDayOfYear
fields.title: Start Day Of Year
fields.description: The earliest integer day of the year on which a dwc:Event occurred.
fields.comments: The value is 1 for January 1 and 365 for December 31, except in a leap year, in which case it is 366.
fields.examples: `1` (1 January); `32` (1 February); `366` (31 December); `365` (30 December in a leap year, 31 December in a non-leap year)
fields.rdfs:comment: The earliest integer day of the year on which the dwc:Event occurred (1 for January 1, 365 for December 31, except in a leap year, in which case it is 366).

fields.name: endDayOfYear
fields.title: End Day Of Year
fields.description: The latest integer day of the year on which a dwc:Event occurred.
fields.comments: The value is 1 for January 1 and 365 for December 31, except in a leap year, in which case it is 366.
fields.examples: `1` (1 January); `32` (1 February); `366` (31 December); `365` (30 December in a leap year, 31 December in a non-leap year)
fields.rdfs:comment: The latest integer day of the year on which the dwc:Event occurred (1 for January 1, 365 for December 31, except in a leap year, in which case it is 366).

fields.name: year
fields.title: Year
fields.description: The four-digit year in which the dwc:Event occurred, according to the Common Era Calendar.
fields.rdfs:comment: The four-digit year in which the dwc:Event occurred, according to the Common Era Calendar.

fields.name: month
fields.title: Month
fields.description: The integer month in which the dwc:Event occurred.
fields.rdfs:comment: The integer month in which the dwc:Event occurred.

fields.name: day
fields.title: Day
fields.description: The integer day of the month on which the dwc:Event occurred.
fields.rdfs:comment: The integer day of the month on which the dwc:Event occurred.

fields.name: verbatimEventDate
fields.title: Verbatim Event Date
fields.description: The verbatim original representation of the date and time information for a dwc:Event.
fields.rdfs:comment: The verbatim original representation of the date and time information for a dwc:Event.

fields.name: verbatimLocality
fields.title: Verbatim Locality
fields.description: An original textual description of a dcterms:Location.
fields.examples: `25 km NNE Bariloche por R. Nac. 237`
fields.rdfs:comment: The original textual description of the place.

fields.name: verbatimElevation
fields.title: Verbatim Elevation
fields.description: An original description of the elevation of a dcterms:Location.
fields.rdfs:comment: The original description of the elevation (altitude, usually above sea level) of the Location.

fields.name: verbatimDepth
fields.title: Verbatim Depth
fields.description: The original description of the depth below the local surface.
fields.rdfs:comment: The original description of the depth below the local surface.

fields.name: verbatimCoordinates
fields.title: Verbatim Coordinates
fields.description: Verbatim original spatial coordinates of a dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in dwc:verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in dwc:verbatimCoordinateSystem.
fields.rdfs:comment: The verbatim original spatial coordinates of the dcterms:Location. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in dwc:verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in dwc:verbatimCoordinateSystem.

fields.name: verbatimLatitude
fields.title: Verbatim Latitude
fields.description: A verbatim original latitude of a dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in dwc:verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in dwc:verbatimCoordinateSystem.
fields.rdfs:comment: The verbatim original latitude of the dcterms:Location. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in dwc:verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in dwc:verbatimCoordinateSystem.

fields.name: verbatimLongitude
fields.title: Verbatim Longitude
fields.description: A verbatim original longitude of a dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in dwc:verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in dwc:verbatimCoordinateSystem.
fields.rdfs:comment: The verbatim original longitude of the dcterms:Location. The coordinate ellipsoid, geodeticDatum, or full Spatial Reference System (SRS) for these coordinates should be stored in dwc:verbatimSRS and the coordinate system should be stored in dwc:verbatimCoordinateSystem.

fields.name: verbatimCoordinateSystem
fields.title: Verbatim Coordinate System
fields.description: A coordinate format for dwc:verbatimLatitude and dwc:verbatimLongitude or dwc:verbatimCoordinates.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.rdfs:comment: The coordinate format for the dwc:verbatimLatitude and dwc:verbatimLongitude or the dwc:verbatimCoordinates of the dcterms:Location.

fields.name: verbatimSRS
fields.title: Verbatim SRS
fields.description: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which coordinates given in dwc:verbatimLatitude and dwc:verbatimLongitude, or dwc:verbatimCoordinates are based.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use the EPSG code of the SRS, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the geodetic datum, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the ellipsoid, if known. If none of these is known, use the value `not recorded`. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.rdfs:comment: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which coordinates given in dwc:verbatimLatitude and dwc:verbatimLongitude, or dwc:verbatimCoordinates are based.

fields.name: georeferenceVerificationStatus
fields.title: Georeference Verification Status
fields.description: A categorical description of the extent to which the georeference has been verified to represent the best possible spatial description for the dcterms:Location of the dwc:Occurrence.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.examples: `unable to georeference`; `requires georeference`; `requires verification`; `verified by data custodian`; `verified by contributor`
fields.rdfs:comment: A categorical description of the extent to which the georeference has been verified to represent the best possible spatial description for the dcterms:Location of the dwc:Occurrence.

fields.name: habitat
fields.title: Habitat
fields.description: A category or description of the habitat in which the dwc:Event occurred.
fields.comments: This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.rdfs:comment: A category or description of the habitat in which the dwc:Event occurred.

fields.name: eventEffort
fields.title: Event Effort
fields.description: An amount of effort expended during a dwc:Event.
fields.examples: `40 trap-nights`; `10 observer-hours`; `10 km by foot`; `30 km by car`
fields.rdfs:comment: The amount of effort expended during a dwc:Event.

fields.name: fieldNotes
fields.title: Field Notes
fields.description: One of a) an indicator of the existence of, b) a reference to (publication, URI), or c) the text of notes taken in the field about the dwc:Event.
fields.comments: This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.rdfs:comment: One of a) an indicator of the existence of, b) a reference to (publication, URI), or c) the text of notes taken in the field about the dwc:Event.

fields.name: eventReferences
fields.title: Event References
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of dcterms:BibliographicResources associated with a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `http://www.sciencemag.org/cgi/content/abstract/322/5899/261`; `Christopher J. Conroy, Jennifer L. Neuwald. 2008. Phylogeographic study of the California vole, Microtus californicus Journal of Mammalogy, 89(3):755-767.`; `Steven R. Hoofer and Ronald A. Van Den Bussche. 2001. Phylogenetic Relationships of Plecotine Bats and Allies Based on Mitochondrial Ribosomal Sequences. Journal of Mammalogy 82(1):131-137. | Walker, Faith M., Jeffrey T. Foster, Kevin P. Drees, Carol L. Chambers. 2014. Spotted bat (Euderma maculatum) microsatellite discovery using illumina sequencing. Conservation Genetics Resources.`
fields.rdfs:comment: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, bibliographic reference, global unique identifier, URI) of literature associated with the dwc:Occurrence.

fields.name: eventRemarks
fields.title: Event Remarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about the dwc:Event.
fields.examples: `After the recent rains the river is nearly at flood stage.`
fields.rdfs:comment: Comments or notes about the dwc:Event.

fields.name: locationID
fields.title: Location ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for the set of dcterms:Location information. May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

fields.name: higherGeographyID
fields.title: Higher Geography ID
fields.description: An identifier for the geographic region within which the dcterms:Location occurred.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a persistent identifier from a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.
fields.examples: `http://vocab.getty.edu/tgn/1002002` (Ant√°rtida e Islas del Atl√°ntico Sur, Territorio Nacional de la Tierra del Fuego, Argentina).
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for the geographic region within which the dcterms:Location occurred.

fields.name: higherGeography
fields.title: Higher Geography
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of geographic names less specific than the information captured in the dwc:locality term.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `), with terms in order from least specific to most specific.
fields.examples: `North Atlantic Ocean`; `South America | Argentina | Patagonia | Parque Nacional Nahuel Huapi | Neuqu√©n | Los Lagos` with accompanying values `South America` (continent) `Argentina` (country), `Neuqu√©n` (first order division), and `Los Lagos` (second order division)
fields.rdfs:comment: A list (concatenated and separated) of geographic names less specific than the information captured in the dwc:locality term.

fields.name: continent
fields.title: Continent
fields.description: The name of the continent in which the dcterms:Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names. Recommended best practice is to leave this field blank if the dcterms:Location spans multiple entities at this administrative level or if the dcterms:Location might be in one or another of multiple possible entities at this level. Multiplicity and uncertainty of the geographic entity can be captured either in the term dwc:higherGeography or in the term dwc:locality, or both.
fields.rdfs:comment: The name of the continent in which the dcterms:Location occurs.

fields.name: waterBody
fields.title: Water Body
fields.description: The name of the water body in which the dcterms:Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.
fields.rdfs:comment: The name of the water body in which the dcterms:Location occurs.

fields.name: islandGroup
fields.title: Island Group
fields.description: The name of the island group in which the dcterms:Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.
fields.rdfs:comment: The name of the island group in which the dcterms:Location occurs.

fields.name: island
fields.title: Island
fields.description: The name of the island on or near which the dcterms:Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names.
fields.rdfs:comment: The name of the island on or near which the dcterms:Location occurs.

fields.name: country
fields.title: Country
fields.description: The name of the country or major administrative unit in which the dcterms:Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names. Recommended best practice is to leave this field blank if the dcterms:Location spans multiple entities at this administrative level or if the dcterms:Location might be in one or another of multiple possible entities at this level. Multiplicity and uncertainty of the geographic entity can be captured either in the term dwc:higherGeography or in the term dwc:locality, or both.
fields.rdfs:comment: The name of the country or major administrative unit in which the dcterms:Location occurs.

fields.name: countryCode
fields.title: Country Code
fields.description: The standard code for the country in which the dcterms:Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use an ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 country code, or 'ZZ' (for an unknown location or a location unassignable to a single country code), or 'XZ' (for the high seas beyond national jurisdictions). Multiplicity and uncertainty of the geographic entity can be captured either in the term dwc:higherGeography or in the term dwc:locality, or both.
fields.rdfs:comment: The standard code for the country in which the dcterms:Location occurs.

fields.name: stateProvince
fields.title: First Order Division
fields.description: The name of the next smaller administrative region than country (state, province, canton, department, region, etc.) in which the dcterms:Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names. Recommended best practice is to leave this field blank if the dcterms:Location spans multiple entities at this administrative level or if the dcterms:Location might be in one or another of multiple possible entities at this level. Multiplicity and uncertainty of the geographic entity can be captured either in the term dwc:higherGeography or in the term dwc:locality, or both.
fields.rdfs:comment: The name of the next smaller administrative region than country (state, province, canton, department, region, etc.) in which the dcterms:Location occurs.

fields.name: county
fields.title: Second Order Division
fields.description: The full, unabbreviated name of the next smaller administrative region than stateProvince (county, shire, department, etc.) in which the dcterms:Location occurs.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names. Recommended best practice is to leave this field blank if the dcterms:Location spans multiple entities at this administrative level or if the dcterms:Location might be in one or another of multiple possible entities at this level. Multiplicity and uncertainty of the geographic entity can be captured either in the term dwc:higherGeography or in the term dwc:locality, or both.
fields.rdfs:comment: The full, unabbreviated name of the next smaller administrative region than stateProvince (county, shire, department, etc.) in which the dcterms:Location occurs.

fields.name: municipality
fields.title: Municipality
fields.description: The full, unabbreviated name of the next smaller administrative region than county (city, municipality, etc.) in which the dcterms:Location occurs. Do not use this term for a nearby named place that does not contain the actual dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names. Recommended best practice is to leave this field blank if the dcterms:Location spans multiple entities at this administrative level or if the dcterms:Location might be in one or another of multiple possible entities at this level. Multiplicity and uncertainty of the geographic entity can be captured either in the term dwc:higherGeography or in the term dwc:locality, or both.
fields.rdfs:comment: The full, unabbreviated name of the next smaller administrative region than county (city, municipality, etc.) in which the dcterms:Location occurs. Do not use this term for a nearby named place that does not contain the actual dcterms:Location.

fields.name: locality
fields.title: Locality
fields.description: The specific description of the place.
fields.comments: Less specific geographic information can be provided in other geographic terms (dwc:higherGeography, dwc:continent, dwc:country, dwc:stateProvince, dwc:county, dwc:municipality, dwc:waterBody, dwc:island, dwc:islandGroup). This term may contain information modified from the original to correct perceived errors or standardize the description.
fields.examples: `Bariloche, 25 km NNE via Ruta Nacional 40 (=Ruta 237)`; `Queets Rainforest, Olympic National Park`
fields.rdfs:comment: The specific description of the place.

fields.name: siteNumber
fields.title: Site Number
fields.description: An identifier (preferably globally unambiguous) for a named site.

fields.name: minimumElevationInMeters
fields.title: Minimum Elevation In Meters
fields.description: A lower limit of a range of elevation in meters above a dwc:verticalDatum.
fields.comments: See https://docs.gbif.org/georeferencing-best-practices/1.0/en/#img-depth-elevation-distance-above-surface.
fields.rdfs:comment: The lower limit of the range of elevation (altitude, usually above sea level), in meters.

fields.name: maximumElevationInMeters
fields.title: Maximum Elevation In Meters
fields.description: An upper limit of a range of elevation in meters above a dwc:verticalDatum.
fields.comments: See https://docs.gbif.org/georeferencing-best-practices/1.0/en/#img-depth-elevation-distance-above-surface.
fields.rdfs:comment: The upper limit of the range of elevation (altitude, usually above sea level), in meters.

fields.name: verticalDatum
fields.title: Vertical Datum
fields.description: The vertical datum used as the reference upon which the values in the elevation terms are based.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.rdfs:comment: The vertical datum used as the reference upon which the values in the elevation terms are based.

fields.name: minimumDepthInMeters
fields.title: Minimum Depth In Meters
fields.description: The lesser depth of a range of depth below a dwc:verticalDatum.
fields.comments: See https://docs.gbif.org/georeferencing-best-practices/1.0/en/#img-depth-elevation-distance-above-surface.
fields.rdfs:comment: The lesser depth of a range of depth below the local surface, in meters.

fields.name: maximumDepthInMeters
fields.title: Maximum Depth In Meters
fields.description: The greater depth of a range of depth below a dwc:verticalDatum.
fields.comments: See https://docs.gbif.org/georeferencing-best-practices/1.0/en/#img-depth-elevation-distance-above-surface.
fields.rdfs:comment: The greater depth of a range of depth below the local surface, in meters.

fields.name: minimumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters
fields.title: Minimum Distance Above Surface In Meters
fields.description: The lesser distance in a range of distance from a reference surface in the vertical direction, in meters. Use positive values for locations above the surface, negative values for locations below. If depth measures are given, the reference surface is the location given by the depth, otherwise the reference surface is the location given by the elevation.
fields.comments: See https://docs.gbif.org/georeferencing-best-practices/1.0/en/#img-depth-elevation-distance-above-surface.
fields.examples: `-1.5` (below the surface); `4.2` (above the surface); For a 1.5 meter sediment core from the bottom of a lake (at depth 20m) at 300m elevation: verbatimElevation: `300m` minimumElevationInMeters: `300`, maximumElevationInMeters: `300`, verbatimDepth: `20m`, minimumDepthInMeters: `20`, maximumDepthInMeters: `20`, minimumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters: `0`, maximumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters: `-1.5`.
fields.rdfs:comment: The lesser distance in a range of distance from a reference surface in the vertical direction, in meters. Use positive values for locations above the surface, negative values for locations below. If depth measures are given, the reference surface is the location given by the depth, otherwise the reference surface is the location given by the elevation.

fields.name: maximumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters
fields.title: Maximum Distance Above Surface In Meters
fields.description: The greater distance in a range of distance from a reference surface in the vertical direction, in meters. Use positive values for locations above the surface, negative values for locations below. If depth measures are given, the reference surface is the location given by the depth, otherwise the reference surface is the location given by the elevation.
fields.comments: See https://docs.gbif.org/georeferencing-best-practices/1.0/en/#img-depth-elevation-distance-above-surface.
fields.examples: `-1.5` (below the surface); `4.2` (above the surface); For a 1.5 meter sediment core from the bottom of a lake (at depth 20m) at 300m elevation: verbatimElevation: `300m` minimumElevationInMeters: `300`, maximumElevationInMeters: `300`, verbatimDepth: `20m`, minimumDepthInMeters: `20`, maximumDepthInMeters: `20`, minimumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters: `0`, maximumDistanceAboveSurfaceInMeters: `-1.5`.
fields.rdfs:comment: The greater distance in a range of distance from a reference surface in the vertical direction, in meters. Use positive values for locations above the surface, negative values for locations below. If depth measures are given, the reference surface is the location given by the depth, otherwise the reference surface is the location given by the elevation.

fields.name: locationRemarks
fields.title: Location Remarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about the dcterms:Location.
fields.rdfs:comment: Comments or notes about the dcterms:Location.

fields.name: decimalLatitude
fields.title: Decimal Latitude
fields.description: A geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in dwc:geodeticDatum) of a dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: Positive values are north of the Equator, negative values are south of it. Valid values lie between -90 and 90, inclusive.
fields.rdfs:comment: The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in dwc:geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a dcterms:Location. Positive values are north of the Equator, negative values are south of it. Legal values lie between -90 and 90, inclusive.

fields.name: decimalLongitude
fields.title: Decimal Longitude
fields.description: A geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in dwc:geodeticDatum) of a dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative values are west of it. Valid values lie between -180 and 180, inclusive.
fields.rdfs:comment: The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in dwc:geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a dcterms:Location. Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative values are west of it. Legal values lie between -180 and 180, inclusive.

fields.name: geodeticDatum
fields.title: Geodetic Datum
fields.description: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which the geographic coordinates given in dwc:decimalLatitude and dwc:decimalLongitude are based.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use the EPSG code of the SRS, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the geodetic datum, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the ellipsoid, if known. If none of these is known, use the value `not recorded`. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for a string literal value.
fields.rdfs:comment: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which the geographic coordinates given in dwc:decimalLatitude and dwc:decimalLongitude are based.

fields.name: coordinateUncertaintyInMeters
fields.title: Coordinate Uncertainty In Meters
fields.description: A horizontal distance (in meters) from a given dwc:decimalLatitude and dwc:decimalLongitude describing the smallest circle containing the whole of the dcterms:Location. Zero is not a valid value for this term.
fields.comments: Leave the value empty if the uncertainty is unknown, cannot be estimated, or is not applicable (because there are no coordinates).
fields.examples: `30` (reasonable lower limit on or after 2000-05-01 of a GPS reading under good conditions if the actual precision was not recorded at the time); `100` (reasonable lower limit before 2000-05-01 of a GPS reading under good conditions if the actual precision was not recorded at the time); `71` (uncertainty for a UTM coordinate having 100 meter precision and a known spatial reference system)
fields.rdfs:comment: The horizontal distance (in meters) from the given dwc:decimalLatitude and dwc:decimalLongitude describing the smallest circle containing the whole of the dcterms:Location. Leave the value empty if the uncertainty is unknown, cannot be estimated, or is not applicable (because there are no coordinates). Zero is not a valid value for this term.

fields.name: coordinatePrecision
fields.title: Coordinate Precision
fields.description: A decimal representation of the precision of the coordinates given in the dwc:decimalLatitude and dwc:decimalLongitude.
fields.examples: `0.00001` (normal GPS limit for decimal degrees); `0.000278` (nearest second); `0.01667` (nearest minute); `1.0` (nearest degree)
fields.rdfs:comment: A decimal representation of the precision of the coordinates given in the dwc:decimalLatitude and dwc:decimalLongitude.

fields.name: pointRadiusSpatialFit
fields.title: Point Radius Spatial Fit
fields.description: A ratio of the area of a point-radius (dwc:decimalLatitude, dwc:decimalLongitude, dwc:coordinateUncertaintyInMeters) to the area of a true (original, or most specific) spatial representation of a dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: Legal values are 0, greater than or equal to 1, or undefined. A value of 1 is an exact match or 100% overlap. A value of 0 should be used if the given point-radius does not completely contain the original representation. The pointRadiusSpatialFit is undefined (and should be left empty) if the original representation is any geometry without area (e.g., a point or polyline) and without uncertainty and the given georeference is not that same geometry (without uncertainty). If both the original and the given georeference are the same point, the pointRadiusSpatialFit is 1. Detailed explanations with graphical examples can be found in the Georeferencing Best Practices, Chapman and Wieczorek, 2020 (https://doi.org/10.15468/doc-gg7h-s853).
fields.rdfs:comment: The ratio of the area of the point-radius (dwc:decimalLatitude, dwc:decimalLongitude, dwc:coordinateUncertaintyInMeters) to the area of the true (original, or most specific) spatial representation of the dcterms:Location. Legal values are 0, greater than or equal to 1, or undefined. A value of 1 is an exact match or 100% overlap. A value of 0 should be used if the given point-radius does not completely contain the original representation. The dwc:pointRadiusSpatialFit is undefined (and should be left empty) if the original representation is any geometry without area (e.g., a point or polyline) and without uncertainty and the given georeference is not that same geometry (without uncertainty). If both the original and the given georeference are the same point, the dwc:pointRadiusSpatialFit is 1.

fields.name: footprintWKT
fields.title: Footprint WKT
fields.description: A Well-Known Text (WKT) representation of the shape (footprint, geometry) that defines a dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: A dcterms:Location may have both a point-radius representation (see dwc:decimalLatitude) and a footprint representation, and they may differ from each other.
fields.examples: `POLYGON ((10 20, 11 20, 11 21, 10 21, 10 20))` (the one-degree bounding box with opposite corners at longitude=10, latitude=20 and longitude=11, latitude=21)
fields.rdfs:comment: A Well-Known Text (WKT) representation of the shape (footprint, geometry) that defines the dcterms:Location. A dcterms:Location may have both a point-radius representation (see dwc:decimalLatitude) and a footprint representation, and they may differ from each other.

fields.name: footprintSRS
fields.title: Footprint SRS
fields.description: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which the geometry given in dwc:footprintWKT is based.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use the EPSG code of the SRS, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the geodetic datum, if known. Otherwise use a controlled vocabulary for the name or code of the ellipsoid, if known. If none of these is known, use the value `not recorded`. It is also permitted to provide the SRS in Well-Known-Text, especially if no EPSG code provides the necessary values for the attributes of the SRS. Do not use this term to describe the SRS of the dwc:decimalLatitude and dwc:decimalLongitude, nor of any verbatim coordinates - use the dwc:geodeticDatum and dwc:verbatimSRS instead. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.examples: `EPSG:4326`; `GEOGCS["GCS_WGS_1984", DATUM["D_WGS_1984", SPHEROID["WGS_1984",6378137,298.257223563]], PRIMEM["Greenwich",0], UNIT["Degree",0.0174532925199433]]` (WKT for the standard WGS84 Spatial Reference System EPSG:4326); `not recorded`
fields.rdfs:comment: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which the geometry given in dwc:footprintWKT is based.

fields.name: footprintSpatialFit
fields.title: Footprint Spatial Fit
fields.description: A ratio of the area of a footprint (dwc:footprintWKT) to the area of a true (original, or most specific) spatial representation of a dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: Legal values are 0, greater than or equal to 1, or undefined. A value of 1 is an exact match or 100% overlap. A value of 0 should be used if the given footprint does not completely contain the original representation. A dwc:footprintSpatialFit is undefined (and should be left empty) if the original representation is any geometry without area (e.g., a point or polyline) and without uncertainty and the given georeference is not that same geometry (without uncertainty). If both the original and the given georeference are the same point, a dwc:footprintSpatialFit is 1. Detailed explanations with graphical examples can be found in the Georeferencing Best Practices, Chapman and Wieczorek, 2020 (https://doi.org/10.15468/doc-gg7h-s853).
fields.rdfs:comment: The ratio of the area of the dwc:footprintWKT to the area of the true (original, or most specific) spatial representation of the dcterms:Location. Legal values are 0, greater than or equal to 1, or undefined. A value of 1 is an exact match or 100% overlap. A value of 0 should be used if the given dwc:footprintWKT does not completely contain the original representation. The dwc:footprintSpatialFit is undefined (and should be left empty) if the original representation is any geometry without area (e.g., a point or polyline) and without uncertainty and the given georeference is not that same geometry (without uncertainty). If both the original and the given georeference are the same point, the dwc:footprintSpatialFit is 1.

fields.name: georeferencedBy
fields.title: Georeferenced By
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of dcterms:Agents responsible for determining a georeference (spatial representation) for a dcterms:Location.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.rdfs:comment: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who determined the georeference (spatial representation) for the dcterms:Location.

fields.name: georeferencedByID
fields.title: Georeferenced By ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dcterms:Agent responsible for determining a georeference for a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.rdfs:comment: A person, group, or organization who determined the georeference (spatial representation) for the dcterms:Location.

fields.name: georeferencedDate
fields.title: Georeferenced Date
fields.description: The date on which the dcterms:Location was georeferenced.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.
fields.examples: `1963-03-08T14:07-06:00` (8 Mar 1963 at or after 2:07pm and before 2:08pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC); `2009-02-20T08:40Z` (20 February 2009 at or after 8:40am and before 8:41 UTC); `2018-08-29T15:19` (29 August 2018 at or after 3:19pm and before 3:20pm local time); `1809-02-12` (within the day 12 February 1809); `1906-06` (in the month of June 1906); `1971` (in the year 1971); `2007-03-01T13:00:00Z/2008-05-11T15:30:00Z` (some time within the interval beginning 1 March 2007 at 1pm UTC and before 11 May 2008 at 3:30pm UTC); `1900/1909` (some time within the interval between the beginning of the year 1900 and before the year 1909); `2007-11-13/15` (some time in the interval between the beginning of 13 November 2007 and before 15 November 2007)
fields.rdfs:comment: The date on which the dcterms:Location was georeferenced.

fields.name: georeferenceProtocol
fields.title: Georeference Protocol
fields.description: A description or reference to a dwc:Protocol used to determine a spatial footprint, coordinates, and uncertainties.
fields.comments: This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.examples: `Georeferencing Quick Reference Guide (Zermoglio et al. 2020, https://doi.org/10.35035/e09p-h128)`
fields.rdfs:comment: A description or reference to the methods used to determine the spatial footprint, coordinates, and uncertainties.

fields.name: georeferenceSources
fields.title: Georeference Sources
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of maps, gazetteers, or other resources used to georeference a dcterms:Location, described specifically enough to allow anyone in the future to use the same resources.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.examples: `GeoLocate`, `GeoPick`; `https://www.geonames.org/`; `USGS 1:24000 Florence Montana Quad 1967 | Terrametrics 2008 on Google Earth`
fields.rdfs:comment: A list (concatenated and separated) of maps, gazetteers, or other resources used to georeference the dcterms:Location, described specifically enough to allow anyone in the future to use the same resources.

fields.name: georeferenceRemarks
fields.title: Georeference Remarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about the spatial description determination, explaining assumptions made in addition or opposition to the those formalized in the method referred to in dwc:georeferenceProtocol.
fields.rdfs:comment: Comments or notes about the spatial description determination, explaining assumptions made in addition or opposition to the those formalized in the method referred to in dwc:georeferenceProtocol.

fields.name: preferredSpatialRepresentation
fields.title: Preferred Spatial Representation
fields.description: An indication of which spatial representation best represents the dcterms:Location.

fields.name: feedbackURL
fields.title: Feedback URL
fields.description: A uniform resource locator (URL) that points to a webpage on which a form may be submitted to gather feedback about the record.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to optionally include query strings that act to pre-populate web page form elements and communicate the context.
fields.rdfs:comment: A uniform resource locator (URL) that points to a webpage on which a form may be submitted to gather feedback about the record.

fields.name: informationWithheld
fields.title: Information Withheld
fields.description: Additional information that exists about a resource, but that is not shared publicly. Suggests that alternative data of higher quality may be available on request.
fields.comments: This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.examples: `location information not given for endangered species`; `collector identities withheld | ask about tissue samples`
fields.rdfs:comment: Additional information that exists, but that has not been shared in the given record.

fields.name: dataGeneralizations
fields.title: Data Generalizations
fields.description: Actions taken to make the shared data less specific or complete than in its original form. Suggests that alternative data of higher quality may be available on request.
fields.comments: This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.examples: `Coordinates generalized from original GPS coordinates to the nearest half degree grid cell.`
fields.rdfs:comment: Actions taken to make the shared data less specific or complete than in its original form. Suggests that alternative data of higher quality may be available on request.

fields.name: mediaID
fields.title: Media ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Media resource.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: eventID
fields.title: Event ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for the set of information associated with a dwc:Event (something that occurs at a place and time). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

fields.name: subjectCategory
fields.title: Subject Category
fields.description: A category for the content of a dwc:Media resource.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: subjectCategoryIRI
fields.title: Subject Category IRI
fields.description: An IRI of a controlled vocabulary value for the subject category of a dwc:Media resource.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: subjectCategorySource
fields.title: Subject Category Source
fields.description: A reference to a controlled vocabulary in which the definition of a value in dwc:subjectCategory is given.
fields.comments: The Audiovisual Core recommended vocabularies do not need to be cited here. There is no required linkage between individual Subject Category terms and the vocabulary; the mechanism is intended to support discovery of the normative URI for a term, but not guarantee it.
fields.rdfs:comment: Any vocabulary or formal classification from which terms in the Subject Category have been drawn.

fields.name: subjectPartLiteral
fields.title: Subject Part Literal
fields.description: The portion or product of organism morphology, behaviour, environment, etc. that is either predominantly shown or particularly well exemplified by the dwc:Media resource, denoted by a controlled value string.
fields.comments: Values SHOULD be selected from the Controlled Vocabulary for ac:subjectPart. It is best practice to use ac:subjectPart instead of ac:subjectPartLiteral whenever practical.
fields.rdfs:comment: The portion or product of organism morphology, behaviour, environment, etc. that is either predominantly shown or particularly well exemplified by the media resource, denoted by a controlled value string.

fields.name: subjectPart
fields.title: Subject Part
fields.description: The portion or product of organism morphology, behaviour, environment, etc. that is either predominantly shown or particularly well exemplified by the dwc:Media resource, denoted by an IRI.
fields.rdfs:comment: The portion or product of organism morphology, behaviour, environment, etc. that is either predominantly shown or particularly well exemplified by the media resource, denoted by an IRI.

fields.name: subjectOrientationLiteral
fields.title: Subject Orientation Literal
fields.description: Specific orientation (= direction, view angle) of the subject represented in the dwc:Media resource with respect to the acquisition device, denoted by a controlled value string.
fields.comments: Values SHOULD be selected from the Controlled Vocabulary for ac:subjectOrientation. It is best practice to use ac:subjectOrientation instead of ac:subjectOrientationLiteral whenever practical.
fields.rdfs:comment: Specific orientation (= direction, view angle) of the subject represented in the media resource with respect to the acquisition device, denoted by a controlled value string.

fields.name: subjectOrientation
fields.title: Subject Orientation
fields.description: Specific orientation (= direction, view angle) of the subject represented in the dwc:Media resource with respect to the acquisition device.
fields.rdfs:comment: Specific orientation (= direction, view angle) of the subject represented in the media resource with respect to the acquisition device, denoted by an IRI.

fields.name: physicalSetting
fields.title: Physical Setting
fields.description: The setting of the content represented in a dwc:Media resource, such as images, sounds, and movies if the provider deems them relevant.
fields.rdfs:comment: The setting of the content represented in a dwc:Media resource, such as images, sounds, and movies if the provider deems them relevant.

fields.name: identificationID
fields.title: Identification ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Identification.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for the dwc:Identification (the body of information associated with the assignment of a scientific name). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

fields.name: mediaID
fields.title: Media ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Media resource based on which a dwc:Identification was made.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: verbatimIdentification
fields.title: Verbatim Identification
fields.description: A string representing the taxonomic identification as it appeared in the original record.
fields.comments: This term is meant to allow the capture of an unaltered original identification/determination, including identification qualifiers, hybrid formulas, uncertainties, etc. This term is meant to be used in addition to dwc:scientificName (and dwc:identificationQualifier etc.), not instead of it.
fields.examples: `Peromyscus sp.`; `Ministrymon sp. nov. 1`; `Anser anser √ó Branta canadensis`; `Pachyporidae?`; `Potentilla √ó pantotricha Soj√°k`; `Aconitum pilipes √ó A. variegatum`; `Lepomis auritus x cyanellus`
fields.rdfs:comment: A string representing the taxonomic identification as it appeared in the original record.

fields.name: isAcceptedIdentification
fields.title: Is Accepted Identification
fields.description: An indicator that this dwc:Identification of a dwc:Organism is a currently an accepted or preferred one.

fields.name: taxonFormula
fields.title: Taxon Formula
fields.description: A string representing the pattern to use to construct a dwc:Identification from dwc:Taxon names and identification qualifiers.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as https://arctos.database.museum/info/ctDocumentation.cfm?table=cttaxa_formula.
fields.examples: `A`; `A ?`; `A or B`; `A and B`; `A x B`; `A cf.`; `A aff.`

fields.name: typeStatus
fields.title: Type Status
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of nomenclatural types (type status, typified scientific name, publication) applied to the subject.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `). This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.rdfs:comment: A list (concatenated and separated) of nomenclatural types (type status, typified scientific name, publication) applied to the subject.

fields.name: typeDesignationType
fields.title: typeDesignationType
fields.description: A category that best matches the nature of a type designation.
fields.comments: From https://rs.gbif.org/extension/gbif/1.0/typesandspecimen.xml.
fields.rdfs:comment: The reason why this specimen or name is designated as a type.

fields.name: identifiedBy
fields.title: Identified By
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of dcterms:Agents responsible for making a taxonomic determination of a dwc:Organism.
fields.comments: When used in the context of a dwc:Survey, the subject consists of all of the dwc:Identifications related to the dwc:Survey. Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.rdfs:comment: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who assigned the dwc:Taxon to the subject.

fields.name: identifiedByID
fields.title: Identified By ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dcterms:Agent responsible for making a dwc:Identification.
fields.comments: When used in the context of a dwc:Survey, the subject consists of all of the dwc:Identifications related to the dwc:Survey. Recommended best practice is to provide a single identifier that disambiguates the details of the identifying dcterma:Agent. If a list is used, the order of the identifiers on the list should not be assumed to convey any semantics. Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0097` (for an individual); `https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0097 | https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1825-0098` (for a list of people)
fields.rdfs:comment: A person, group, or organization who assigned the dwc:Taxon to the subject.

fields.name: dateIdentified
fields.title: Date Identified
fields.description: The date on which the subject was determined as representing the dwc:Taxon.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.
fields.examples: `1963-03-08T14:07-06:00` (8 Mar 1963 at or after 2:07pm and before 2:08pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC); `2009-02-20T08:40Z` (20 February 2009 at or after 8:40am and before 8:41 UTC); `2018-08-29T15:19` (29 August 2018 at or after 3:19pm and before 3:20pm local time); `1809-02-12` (within the day 12 February 1809); `1906-06` (in the month of June 1906); `1971` (in the year 1971); `2007-03-01T13:00:00Z/2008-05-11T15:30:00Z` (some time within the interval beginning 1 March 2007 at 1pm UTC and before 11 May 2008 at 3:30pm UTC); `1900/1909` (some time within the interval between the beginning of the year 1900 and before the year 1909); `2007-11-13/15` (some time in the interval between the beginning of 13 November 2007 and before 15 November 2007)
fields.rdfs:comment: The date on which the subject was determined as representing the dwc:Taxon.

fields.name: identificationReferences
fields.title: Identification References
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of dcterms:BibliographicResources used in the dwc:Identification.
fields.comments: When used in the context of a dwc:Survey, the subject consists of all of the dwc:Identifications related to the dwc:Survey. Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `Aves del Noroeste Patagonico. Christie et al. 2004.`; `Stebbins, R. Field Guide to Western Reptiles and Amphibians. 3rd Edition. 2003. | Irschick, D.J. and Shaffer, H.B. (1997). The polytypic species revisited: Morphological differentiation among tiger salamanders (Ambystoma tigrinum) (Amphibia: Caudata). Herpetologica, 53(1), 30-49.`
fields.rdfs:comment: A list (concatenated and separated) of references (publication, global unique identifier, URI) used in the dwc:Identification.

fields.name: taxonAssignmentMethod
fields.title: Taxon Assignment Method
fields.description: Tool and thresholds used to compare sequences when computing 'species-level' OTUs.

fields.name: identificationVerificationStatus
fields.title: Identification Verification Status
fields.description: A categorical indicator of the extent to which a taxonomic determination has been verified to be correct.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as that used in HISPID and ABCD. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value.
fields.rdfs:comment: A categorical indicator of the extent to which a dwc:Identification has been verified to be correct.

fields.name: identificationRemarks
fields.title: Identification Remarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about the dwc:Identification.
fields.examples: `Distinguished between Anthus correndera and Anthus hellmayri based on the comparative lengths of the u√±as.`
fields.rdfs:comment: Comments or notes about the dwc:Identification.

fields.name: taxonID
fields.title: Taxon ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Taxon.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for the set of dwc:Taxon information. May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

fields.name: scientificNameID
fields.title: Scientific Name ID
fields.description: An identifier for the nomenclatural (not taxonomic) details of a scientific name.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for the nomenclatural (not taxonomic) details of a scientific name.

fields.name: geoClassificationCode
fields.title: Geo Classification Code
fields.description: An identifier for a minext:classificationCode.
fields.comments: Classification codes are specific to a classification system and conform to a xkos:notationPattern.
fields.rdfs:comment: Alphanumeric pattern that adheres to a defined encoding scheme that identifies a particular term in a classification scheme.

fields.name: geoName
fields.title: Geo Name
fields.description: A human-readable lexical label assigned to a mineral includes both informal (e.g., variety, synonym) and formal (classification) forms.
fields.rdfs:comment: A human-readable lexical label assigned to a mineral includes both informal (e.g., variety, synonym) and formal (classification) forms.

fields.name: scientificName
fields.title: Scientific Name
fields.description: A scientific name string, not including authorship, date or identification qualifiers.
fields.comments: When applied to an Organism or Occurrence, this term should be used to represent the scientific name that was applied to the associated Organism in accordance with the Taxon to which it was or is currently identified. Names should be compliant to the most recent nomenclatural code. For example, names of hybrids for algae, fungi and plants should follow the rules of the International Code of Nomenclature for algae, fungi, and plants (Schenzhen Code Articles H.1, H.2 and H.3). Thus, use the multiplication sign `√ó` (Unicode `U+00D7`, HTML `×`) to identify a hybrid, not `x` or `X`, if possible.
fields.examples: `Coleoptera` (order); `Vespertilionidae` (family); `Manis` (genus); `Ctenomys sociabilis` (genus + specificEpithet); `Ambystoma tigrinum diaboli` (genus + specificEpithet + infraspecificEpithet); `Quercus agrifolia var. oxyadenia` (genus + specificEpithet + taxonRank + infraspecificEpithet); `√óAgropogon littoralis`; `Mentha √ósmithiana`; `Agrostis stolonifera L. √ó Polypogon monspeliensis`
fields.rdfs:comment: The full scientific name, with authorship and date information if known. When forming part of a dwc:Identification, this should be the name in lowest level taxonomic rank that can be determined. This term should not contain identification qualifications, which should instead be supplied in the dwc:identificationQualifier term.

fields.name: scientificNameAuthorship
fields.title: Scientific Name Authorship
fields.description: The authorship information for the dwc:scientificName formatted according to the conventions of the applicable dwc:nomenclaturalCode.
fields.rdfs:comment: The authorship information for the dwc:scientificName formatted according to the conventions of the applicable dwc:nomenclaturalCode.

fields.name: vernacularName
fields.title: Vernacular Name
fields.description: A common or vernacular name.
fields.rdfs:comment: A common or vernacular name.

fields.name: taxonRank
fields.title: Taxon Rank
fields.description: The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in the dwc:scientificName.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. The taxon ranks of algae, fungi and plants are defined in the International Code of Nomenclature for algae, fungi, and plants (Schenzhen Code Articles H3.2, H4.4 and H.3.1).
fields.rdfs:comment: The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in the dwc:scientificName.

fields.name: externalClassificationSource
fields.title: External Classification Source
fields.description: A reference to a source outside the dataset where the identifying name, code, or taxon concept can be found.
fields.comments: The external source applies to whichever of dwc:taxonID, dwc:scientificNameID, minext:geoClassificationCode, minext:geoName, dwc:scientificName, or dwc:vernacularName is populated.
fields.examples: `http://www.catalogueoflife.org/data/taxon/`; `https://avibase.bsc-eoc.org/`; `Dana, J. D., Dana, E. S., & Gaines, R. V. (1997). Dana's new mineralogy: The system of mineralogy of James Dwight Dana and Edward Salisbury Dana.`; `Strunz H, Nickel EH (2001) Strunz Mineralogical Tables, 9th Edition. Berlin and Stuttgart 870 pp.`
fields.rdfs:comment: A related resource from which the described resource is derived.

fields.name: kingdom
fields.title: Kingdom
fields.description: The full scientific name of the kingdom in which the dwc:Taxon is classified.
fields.rdfs:comment: The full scientific name of the kingdom in which the dwc:Taxon is classified.

fields.name: phylum
fields.title: Phylum
fields.description: The full scientific name of the phylum or division in which the dwc:Taxon is classified.
fields.rdfs:comment: The full scientific name of the phylum or division in which the dwc:Taxon is classified.

fields.name: class
fields.title: Class
fields.description: The full scientific name of the class in which the dwc:Taxon is classified.
fields.rdfs:comment: The full scientific name of the class in which the dwc:Taxon is classified.

fields.name: order
fields.title: Order
fields.description: The full scientific name of the order in which the dwc:Taxon is classified.
fields.rdfs:comment: The full scientific name of the order in which the dwc:Taxon is classified.

fields.name: family
fields.title: Family
fields.description: The full scientific name of the family in which the dwc:Taxon is classified.
fields.rdfs:comment: The full scientific name of the family in which the dwc:Taxon is classified.

fields.name: subfamily
fields.title: Subfamily
fields.description: The full scientific name of the subfamily in which the dwc:Taxon is classified.
fields.rdfs:comment: The full scientific name of the subfamily in which the dwc:Taxon is classified.

fields.name: genus
fields.title: Genus
fields.description: The full scientific name of the genus in which the dwc:Taxon is classified.
fields.rdfs:comment: The full scientific name of the genus in which the dwc:Taxon is classified.

fields.name: genericName
fields.title: Generic Name
fields.description: The genus part of the dwc:scientificName without authorship.
fields.comments: For synonyms the accepted genus and the genus part of the name may be different. The term dwc:genericName should be used together with dwc:specificEpithet to form a binomial and with dwc:infraspecificEpithet to form a trinomial. The term dwc:genericName should only be used for combinations. Uninomials of generic rank do not have a dwc:genericName.
fields.examples: `Felis` (for scientificName `Felis concolor`, with accompanying values of `Puma concolor` in acceptedNameUsage and `Puma` in genus)
fields.rdfs:comment: The genus part of the dwc:scientificName without authorship.

fields.name: subgenus
fields.title: Subgenus
fields.description: The full scientific name of the subgenus in which the dwc:Taxon is classified.
fields.comments: A value for this term should be a complete subgenus name as required by the appropriate nomenclatural code.
fields.rdfs:comment: The full scientific name of the subgenus in which the dwc:Taxon is classified.

fields.name: infragenericEpithet
fields.title: Infrageneric Epithet
fields.description: The infrageneric part of a binomial name at ranks above species but below genus.
fields.comments: The term dwc:infragenericEpithet should be used in conjunction with dwc:genericName, dwc:specificEpithet, dwc:infraspecificEpithet, dwc:taxonRank and dwc:scientificNameAuthorship to represent the individual elements of the complete dwc:scientificName. It can be used to indicate the subgenus placement of a species, which in zoology is often given in parentheses. Can also be used to share infrageneric names such as botanical sections (e.g., `Vicia sect. Cracca`).
fields.rdfs:comment: The infrageneric part of a binomial name at ranks above species but below genus.

fields.name: specificEpithet
fields.title: Specific Epithet
fields.description: The name of the first or species epithet of the dwc:scientificName.
fields.rdfs:comment: The name of the first or species epithet of the dwc:scientificName.

fields.name: infraspecificEpithet
fields.title: Infraspecific Epithet
fields.description: The name of the first or species epithet of the dwc:scientificName.
fields.comments: In botany, name strings in literature and identifications may have multiple infraspecific ranks. According to the International Code of Nomenclature for algae, fungi, and plants (Schenzhen Code Articles 6.7 & Art. 24.1), valid names only have two epithets, with the lowest rank being the dwc:infraspecificEpithet. For example: the dwc:infraspecificEpithet in the string `Indigofera charlieriana subsp. sessilis var. scaberrima` is `scaberrima` and the dwc:scientificName is `Indigofera charlieriana var. scaberrima (Schinz) J.B.Gillett`. Use dwc:verbatimIdentification for the full name string used in a dwc:Identification.
fields.examples: `concolor` (for scientificName `Puma concolor concolor`); `oxyadenia` (for scientificName `Quercus agrifolia var. oxyadenia`); `laxa` (for scientificName `Cheilanthes hirta f. laxa`); `scaberrima` (for scientificName `Indigofera charlieriana var. scaberrima`)
fields.rdfs:comment: The name of the first or species epithet of the dwc:scientificName.

fields.name: cultivarEpithet
fields.title: Cultivar Epithet
fields.description: Part of the name of a cultivar, cultivar group or grex that follows the dwc:scientificName.
fields.comments: According to the Rules of the Cultivated Plant Code, a cultivar name consists of a botanical name followed by a cultivar epithet. The value given as the dwc:cultivarEpithet should exclude any quotes. The term dwc:taxonRank should be used to indicate which type of cultivated plant name (e.g. cultivar, cultivar group, grex) is concerned. This epithet, including any enclosing apostrophes or suffix, should be provided in dwc:scientificName as well.
fields.examples: `King Edward` (for scientificName `Solanum tuberosum 'King Edward'` and taxonRank `cultivar`); `Mishmiense` (for scientificName `Rhododendron boothii Mishmiense Group` and taxonRank `cultivar group`); `Atlantis` (for scientificName `Paphiopedilum Atlantis grex` and taxonRank `grex`)
fields.rdfs:comment: Part of the name of a cultivar, cultivar group or grex that follows the dwc:scientificName.

fields.name: nameAccordingTo
fields.title: Name According To
fields.description: The reference to the source in which the specific taxon concept circumscription is defined or implied - traditionally signified by the Latin "sensu" or "sec." (from secundum, meaning "according to"). For taxa that result from identifications, a reference to the keys, monographs, experts and other sources should be given.
fields.comments: This term provides context to the dwc:scientificName. Together with the dwc:scientificName, separated by `sensu` or `sec.`, it forms the taxon concept label, which may be seen as having the same relationship to dwc:taxonConceptID as, for example, dwc:acceptedNameUsage has to dwc:acceptedNameUsageID. When not provided, in Taxon Core data sets the dwc:nameAccordingTo can be taken to be the data set. In this case the data set mostly provides sufficient context to infer the delimitation of the taxon and its relationship with other taxa. In Occurrence Core data sets, when not provided, dwc:nameAccordingTo can be an underlying taxonomy of the data set, e.g. Plants of the World Online (http://powo.science.kew.org/) for vascular plant records in iNaturalist (in which case it should be provided), or, which is the case for most dwc:PreservedSpecimen data sets, the dwc:Identification, in which case there is no further context.
fields.examples: `Franz NM, Cardona-Duque J (2013) Description of two new species and phylogenetic reassessment of Perelleschus Wibmer & O‚ÄôBrien, 1986 (Coleoptera: Curculionidae), with a complete taxonomic concept history of Perelleschus sec. Franz & Cardona-Duque, 2013. Syst Biodivers. 11: 209‚Äì236.` (as the full citation of the Franz & Cardona-Duque (2013) in Perelleschus splendida sec. Franz & Cardona-Duque (2013))
fields.rdfs:comment: The reference to the source in which the specific taxon concept circumscription is defined or implied - traditionally signified by the Latin "sensu" or "sec." (from secundum, meaning "according to"). For taxa that result from identifications, a reference to the keys, monographs, experts and other sources should be given.

fields.name: nomenclaturalCode
fields.title: Nomenclatural Code
fields.description: The nomenclatural code (or codes in the case of an ambiregnal name) under which the dwc:scientificName is constructed.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.
fields.rdfs:comment: The nomenclatural code (or codes in the case of an ambiregnal name) under which the dwc:scientificName is constructed.

fields.name: nomenclaturalStatus
fields.title: Nomenclatural Status
fields.description: The status related to the original publication of the name and its conformance to the relevant rules of nomenclature. It is based essentially on an algorithm according to the business rules of the code. It requires no taxonomic opinion.
fields.rdfs:comment: The status related to the original publication of the name and its conformance to the relevant rules of nomenclature. It is based essentially on an algorithm according to the business rules of the code. It requires no taxonomic opinion.

fields.name: namePublishedIn
fields.title: Name Published In
fields.description: A reference for the publication in which the dwc:scientificName was originally established under the rules of the associated dwc:nomenclaturalCode.
fields.comments: A citation of the first publication of the name in its given combination, not the basionym / original name. Recombinations are often not published in zoology, in which case dwc:namePublishedIn should be empty.
fields.examples: `Pearson O. P., and M. I. Christie. 1985. Historia Natural, 5(37):388`; `Forel, Auguste, Diagnosies provisoires de quelques esp√®ces nouvelles de fourmis de Madagascar, r√©colt√©es par M. Grandidier., Annales de la Societe Entomologique de Belgique, Comptes-rendus des Seances 30, 1886`
fields.rdfs:comment: A reference for the publication in which the dwc:scientificName was originally established under the rules of the associated dwc:nomenclaturalCode.

fields.name: namePublishedInYear
fields.title: Name Published In Year
fields.description: The four-digit year in which the dwc:scientificName was published.
fields.rdfs:comment: The four-digit year in which the dwc:scientificName was published.

fields.name: taxonRemarks
fields.title: Taxon Remarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about the taxon or name.
fields.examples: `this name is a misspelling in common use`
fields.rdfs:comment: Comments or notes about the taxon or name.

fields.name: feedbackURL
fields.title: Feedback URL
fields.description: A uniform resource locator (URL) that points to a webpage on which a form may be submitted to gather feedback about the record.
fields.comments: A uniform resource locator (URL) that points to a webpage on which a form may be submitted to gather feedback about the record.
fields.rdfs:comment: A uniform resource locator (URL) that points to a webpage on which a form may be submitted to gather feedback about the record.

fields.name: mediaID
fields.title: Media ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Media resource.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: derivedFromMediaID
fields.title: Derived From Media ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Media resource from which this dwc:Media resource was derived.
fields.comments: This term can be used when a dwc:Media resource has been separated from its source dwc:Media resource. Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: isPartOfMediaID
fields.title: Is Part Of Media ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Media resource of which this dwc:Media resource is a part.
fields.comments: This term can be used to define an ac:RegionOfInterest within a dwc:Media resource. Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.rdfs:comment: The media item within which a region of interest is located.

fields.name: mediaType
fields.title: Media Type
fields.description: A category that best matches the nature of a dwc:Media resource.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.rdfs:comment: The nature or genre of the resource.

fields.name: title
fields.title: Title
fields.description: A name given to a resource.
fields.comments: Concise title, name, or brief descriptive label of institution, resource collection, or individual resource. This field SHOULD include the complete title with all the subtitles, if any. It is strongly suggested to provide a title. The title facilitates interactions with humans: e.g., it could be used as display text of hyperlinks or to provide a choice of images in a pick list. The title is therefore highly useful and an effort should be made to provide it where it is not already available. When the resource is a collection without an institutional or official name, but with a thematic content, a descriptive title, e. g. "Urban Ants of New England," would be suitable. In individual media resources depicting taxa, the scientific name or names of taxa often form a good title. Common names in addition to or instead of scientific names are also acceptable. Indications of action or roles captured by the media resource, such as predatory acts, are desirable ("Rattlesnake eating deer mouse", "Pollinators of California Native Plants").
fields.rdfs:comment: A name given to the resource.

fields.name: description
fields.title: Description
fields.description: An account of the resource.
fields.comments: Description of collection or individual resource, containing the Who, What, When, Where and Why as free-form text. This property optionally allows the presentation of detailed information and will in most cases be shown together with the resource title. If both a description and a caption are present in the metadata, a description is typically displayed instead of the resource, whereas a caption is displayed together with the resource. The description should aim to be a good proxy for the underlying media resource in cases where only text can be shown, whereas the caption may only make sense when shown together with the media. Thus, in HTML it would be appropriate to use dcterms:description values for alt attributes in img elements. Often only one of description or caption is present; choose the term most appropriate for your metadata. It is the role of implementers of an AC concrete representation (e.g., an XML Schema, an RDF representation, etc.) to decide and document how formatting advice will be represented in descriptions serialized according to such representations.
fields.rdfs:comment: An account of the resource.

fields.name: caption
fields.title: Caption
fields.description: Free-form text to be displayed together with (rather than instead of) a resource that is suitable for captions (especially images).
fields.comments: If both description and caption are present in the metadata, a description is typically displayed instead of the resource, a caption together with the resource. Thus, in HTML it would be appropriate to use ac:caption values in figcaption elements. Often only one of description or caption is present; choose the term most appropriate for your metadata.
fields.rdfs:comment: As alternative or in addition to description, a caption is free-form text to be displayed together with (rather than instead of) a resource that is suitable for captions (especially images).

fields.name: subtypeLiteral
fields.title: Subtype Literal
fields.description: A subcategory that allows further specialization of a dwc:Media resource type than mediaType.
fields.comments: The subtypeLiteral term MUST NOT be applied to Collection objects. However, the Description term in the Content Coverage Vocabulary might add further description to a Collection object. Controlled string values SHOULD be selected from the Controlled Vocabulary for ac:subtype. Human-readable information about the Controlled Vocabulary for ac:subtype is at http://rs.tdwg.org/ac/doc/subtype/. It is best practice to use ac:subtype instead of ac:subytpeLiteral whenever practical.
fields.rdfs:comment: A class, represented by a controlled value string, that provides for more specialization of the media item type than dc:type.

fields.name: subtypeIRI
fields.title: Subtype IRI
fields.description: A class, represented by an IRI, that provides for more specialization of a dwc:Media resource type than dcterms:type.
fields.comments: The subtype term MUST NOT be applied to Collection objects. However, the Description term in the Content Coverage Vocabulary might add further description to a Collection object. IRI values SHOULD be selected from the Controlled Vocabulary for ac:subtype. Human-readable information about the Controlled Vocabulary for ac:subtype is at http://rs.tdwg.org/ac/doc/subtype/. In text-based systems such as tables, IRI values MUST be in unabbreviated form.
