fields.description: A category for the content of a dwc:Media resource.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: subjectCategoryIRI
fields.title: Subject Category IRI
fields.description: An IRI of a controlled vocabulary value for the subject category of a dwc:Media resource.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: subjectCategorySource
fields.title: Subject Category Source
fields.description: A reference to a controlled vocabulary in which the definition of a value in dwc:subjectCategory is given.
fields.comments: The Audiovisual Core recommended vocabularies do not need to be cited here. There is no required linkage between individual Subject Category terms and the vocabulary; the mechanism is intended to support discovery of the normative URI for a term, but not guarantee it.
fields.rdfs:comment: Any vocabulary or formal classification from which terms in the Subject Category have been drawn.

fields.name: subjectPartLiteral
fields.title: Subject Part Literal
fields.description: The portion or product of organism morphology, behaviour, environment, etc. that is either predominantly shown or particularly well exemplified by the dwc:Media resource, denoted by a controlled value string.
fields.comments: Values SHOULD be selected from the Controlled Vocabulary for ac:subjectPart. It is best practice to use ac:subjectPart instead of ac:subjectPartLiteral whenever practical.
fields.rdfs:comment: The portion or product of organism morphology, behaviour, environment, etc. that is either predominantly shown or particularly well exemplified by the media resource, denoted by a controlled value string.

fields.name: subjectPart
fields.title: Subject Part
fields.description: The portion or product of organism morphology, behaviour, environment, etc. that is either predominantly shown or particularly well exemplified by the dwc:Media resource, denoted by an IRI.
fields.rdfs:comment: The portion or product of organism morphology, behaviour, environment, etc. that is either predominantly shown or particularly well exemplified by the media resource, denoted by an IRI.

fields.name: subjectOrientationLiteral
fields.title: Subject Orientation Literal
fields.description: Specific orientation (= direction, view angle) of the subject represented in the dwc:Media resource with respect to the acquisition device, denoted by a controlled value string.
fields.comments: Values SHOULD be selected from the Controlled Vocabulary for ac:subjectOrientation. It is best practice to use ac:subjectOrientation instead of ac:subjectOrientationLiteral whenever practical.
fields.rdfs:comment: Specific orientation (= direction, view angle) of the subject represented in the media resource with respect to the acquisition device, denoted by a controlled value string.

fields.name: subjectOrientation
fields.title: Subject Orientation
fields.description: Specific orientation (= direction, view angle) of the subject represented in the dwc:Media resource with respect to the acquisition device.
fields.rdfs:comment: Specific orientation (= direction, view angle) of the subject represented in the media resource with respect to the acquisition device, denoted by an IRI.

fields.name: physicalSetting
fields.title: Physical Setting
fields.description: The setting of the content represented in a dwc:Media resource, such as images, sounds, and movies if the provider deems them relevant.
fields.rdfs:comment: The setting of the content represented in a dwc:Media resource, such as images, sounds, and movies if the provider deems them relevant.

fields.name: organismInteractionID
fields.title: Organism Interaction ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:OrganismInteraction.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: eventID
fields.title: Event ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for the set of information associated with a dwc:Event (something that occurs at a place and time). May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

fields.name: organismInteractionDescription
fields.title: Organism Interaction Description
fields.description: A verbatim description of a dwc:OrganismInteraction.
fields.examples: `Mallophora ruficauda capturing an Apis mellifera worker in flight.`

fields.name: subjectOccurrenceID
fields.title: Subject Occurrence ID
fields.description: An identifier for a subject dwc:Occurrence in a dwc:OrganismInteraction.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for the dwc:Occurrence (as opposed to a particular digital record of the dwc:Occurrence). In the absence of a persistent global unique identifier, construct one from a combination of identifiers in the record that will most closely make the dwc:occurrenceID globally unique.

fields.name: subjectOrganismPart
fields.title: Subject Organism Part
fields.description: A part of a subject dwc:Organism involved in a dwc:OrganismInteraction.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: organismInteractionType
fields.title: Organism Interaction Type
fields.description: A category that best matches the nature of a dwc:OrganismInteraction.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.
fields.examples: `visited flower of`; `pollinated by`; `parasitoid of`; `mated with`; `was attached to`

fields.name: relatedOccurrenceID
fields.title: Related Occurrence ID
fields.description: An identifier for a related dwc:Occurrence in a dwc:OrganismInteraction.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for the dwc:Occurrence (as opposed to a particular digital record of the dwc:Occurrence). In the absence of a persistent global unique identifier, construct one from a combination of identifiers in the record that will most closely make the dwc:occurrenceID globally unique.

fields.name: externalRelatedOccurrenceID
fields.title: External Related Occurrence ID
fields.description: An identifier for the related dwc:Occurrence (the object) of a dwc:ResourceRelationship that is not within the same dataset.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for the dwc:Occurrence (as opposed to a particular digital record of the dwc:Occurrence). In the absence of a persistent global unique identifier, construct one from a combination of identifiers in the record that will most closely make the dwc:occurrenceID globally unique.

fields.name: externalRelatedOccurrenceSource
fields.title: External Related Occurrence Source
fields.description: A reference to a source outside the dataset where the related dwc:Occurrence record can be found.
fields.rdfs:comment: A related resource from which the described resource is derived.

fields.name: relatedOrganismPart
fields.title: Related Organism Part
fields.description: A part of a object dwc:Organism involved in a dwc:OrganismInteraction.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: feedbackURL
fields.title: Feedback URL
fields.description: A uniform resource locator (URL) that points to a webpage on which a form may be submitted to gather feedback about the record.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to optionally include query strings that act to pre-populate web page form elements and communicate the context.
fields.rdfs:comment: A uniform resource locator (URL) that points to a webpage on which a form may be submitted to gather feedback about the record.

fields.name: mediaID
fields.title: Media ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Media resource.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: organismInteractionID
fields.title: Organism Interaction ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:OrganismInteraction.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: subjectCategory
fields.title: Subject Category
fields.description: A category for the content of a dwc:Media resource.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: subjectCategoryIRI
fields.title: Subject Category IRI
fields.description: An IRI of a controlled vocabulary value for the subject category of a dwc:Media resource.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: subjectCategorySource
fields.title: Subject Category Source
fields.description: A reference to a controlled vocabulary in which the definition of a value in dwc:subjectCategory is given.
fields.comments: The Audiovisual Core recommended vocabularies do not need to be cited here. There is no required linkage between individual Subject Category terms and the vocabulary; the mechanism is intended to support discovery of the normative URI for a term, but not guarantee it.
fields.rdfs:comment: Any vocabulary or formal classification from which terms in the Subject Category have been drawn.

fields.name: subjectPartLiteral
fields.title: Subject Part Literal
fields.description: The portion or product of organism morphology, behaviour, environment, etc. that is either predominantly shown or particularly well exemplified by the dwc:Media resource, denoted by a controlled value string.
fields.comments: Values SHOULD be selected from the Controlled Vocabulary for ac:subjectPart. It is best practice to use ac:subjectPart instead of ac:subjectPartLiteral whenever practical.
fields.rdfs:comment: The portion or product of organism morphology, behaviour, environment, etc. that is either predominantly shown or particularly well exemplified by the media resource, denoted by a controlled value string.

fields.name: subjectPart
fields.title: Subject Part
fields.description: The portion or product of organism morphology, behaviour, environment, etc. that is either predominantly shown or particularly well exemplified by the dwc:Media resource.
fields.rdfs:comment: The portion or product of organism morphology, behaviour, environment, etc. that is either predominantly shown or particularly well exemplified by the media resource, denoted by an IRI.

fields.name: subjectOrientationLiteral
fields.title: Subject Orientation Literal
fields.description: Specific orientation (= direction, view angle) of the subject represented in the dwc:Media resource with respect to the acquisition device, denoted by a controlled value string.
fields.comments: Values SHOULD be selected from the Controlled Vocabulary for ac:subjectOrientation. It is best practice to use ac:subjectOrientation instead of ac:subjectOrientationLiteral whenever practical.
fields.rdfs:comment: Specific orientation (= direction, view angle) of the subject represented in the media resource with respect to the acquisition device, denoted by a controlled value string.

fields.name: subjectOrientation
fields.title: Subject Orientation
fields.description: Specific orientation (= direction, view angle) of the subject represented in the dwc:Media resource with respect to the acquisition device.
fields.rdfs:comment: Specific orientation (= direction, view angle) of the subject represented in the media resource with respect to the acquisition device, denoted by an IRI.

fields.name: physicalSetting
fields.title: Physical Setting
fields.description: The setting of the content represented in a dwc:Media resource, such as images, sounds, and movies if the provider deems them relevant.
fields.rdfs:comment: The setting of the content represented in a dwc:Media resource, such as images, sounds, and movies if the provider deems them relevant.

fields.name: provenanceID
fields.title: Provenance ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Provenance.

fields.name: datasetID
fields.title: Dataset ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dataset from which data originated.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for the set of data. May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to a collection or institution.

fields.name: fundingAttribution
fields.title: Funding Attribution
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of the funding organizations or agencies that provided funding for a project.
fields.comments: Specify the full official name of the funding body. This should include the complete name without abbreviations, unless the abbreviation is an official and commonly recognized form (e.g., NSF for the National Science Foundation). Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `Artsdatabanken`; `National Science Foundation`; `Norges forskningsr√•d`; `Ocean Census | Nippon Foundation`
fields.rdfs:comment: A list (concatenated and separated) of the globally unique identifiers for the funding organizations or agencies that supported the project.

fields.name: fundingAttributionID
fields.title: Funding Attribution ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dcterms:Agent that financially supported a project.
fields.comments: Provide a unique identifier for the funding body, such as an identifier used in governmental or international databases. If no official identifier exists, use a persistent and unique identifier within your organization or dataset. Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.rdfs:comment: An identifier for a dcterms:Agent that financially supported a project.

fields.name: source
fields.title: Source
fields.description: A related resource from which this resource is derived.
fields.comments: The described resource may be derived from the related resource in whole or in part. Recommended best practice is to identify the related resource by means of a string conforming to a formal identification system.
fields.rdfs:comment: A related resource from which the described resource is derived.

fields.name: sourceIRI
fields.title: Source IRI
fields.description: An identifier for a resource from which this resource is derived.
fields.comments: This property is intended to be used with non-literal values. The described resource may be derived from the related resource in whole or in part. Best practice is to identify the related resource by means of a URI or a string conforming to a formal identification system.
fields.rdfs:comment: This property is intended to be used with non-literal values. The described resource may be derived from the related resource in whole or in part. Best practice is to identify the related resource by means of a URI or a string conforming to a formal identification system.

fields.name: creatorLiteral
fields.title: Creator
fields.description: A name of a dcterms:Agent primarily responsible for making the resource.
fields.comments: Human readable, or doi number, or URL. Simple name of parent for human readable.
fields.rdfs:comment: An entity primarily responsible for making the resource.

fields.name: creatorID
fields.title: Creator ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dcterms:Agent primarily responsible for making the resource.
fields.comments: Recommended practice is to identify the creator with a URI. If this is not possible or feasible, a literal value that identifies the creator may be provided.
fields.rdfs:comment: An entity primarily responsible for making the resource.

fields.name: providerLiteral
fields.title: Provider
fields.description: A name of a dcterms:Agent responsible for presenting the dwc:Media resource.
fields.comments: If no separate Metadata Provider is given, this also attributes the metadata.
fields.rdfs:comment: Name of the person or organization responsible for presenting the media resource.

fields.name: providerID
fields.title: Provider ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dcterms:Agent responsible for presenting the dwc:Media resource.
fields.comments: If no separate Metadata Provider is given, this also attributes the metadata.
fields.rdfs:comment: URI for person or organization responsible for presenting the media resource.

fields.name: metadataCreatorLiteral
fields.title: Metadata Creator
fields.description: A name of a dcterms:Agent that created the resource metadata.
fields.comments: See also the entry for ac:metadataCreator and the section Namespaces, Prefixes and Term Names in the Audiovisual Core Term List document for discussion of the rationale for separate terms taking URI values from those taking Literal values where both are possible. Normal practice is to use the same Label if both are provided. Labels have no effect on information discovery and are only suggestions.
fields.rdfs:comment: Name of the person or organization originally creating the resource metadata record.

fields.name: metadataCreatorID
fields.title: Metadata Creator ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dcterms:Agent that created the resource metadata.
fields.comments: See also the entry for ac:metadataCreatorLiteral and the section Namespaces, Prefixes and Term Names in the Audiovisual Core Term List document for discussion of the rationale for separate terms taking URI values from those taking Literal values where both are possible. Normal practice is to use the same Label if both are provided. Labels have no effect on information discovery and are only suggestions.
fields.rdfs:comment: A URI representing a person or organization originally creating the resource metadata record.

fields.name: metadataProviderLiteral
fields.title: Metadata Provider
fields.description: A name of a dcterms:Agent that provided the resource metadata.
fields.comments: Media resources and their metadata may be served from different institutions, e. g. in the case of aggregators adding user annotations, taxon identifications, or ratings. Compare Provider. See also the entry for ac:metadataProvider in this document and the section Namespaces, Prefixes and Term Names for discussion of the rationale for separate terms taking URI values from those taking Literal values where both are possible. Normal practice is to use the same Label if both are provided. Labels have no effect on information discovery and are only suggestions.
fields.rdfs:comment: Name of the person or organization originally responsible for providing the resource metadata record.

fields.name: metadataProviderID
fields.title: Metadata Provider ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dcterms:Agent that provided the resource metadata.
fields.comments: Media resources and their metadata may be served from different institutions, e. g. in the case of aggregators adding user annotations, taxon identifications, or ratings. Compare Provider. See also the entry for ac:metadataProviderLiteral and the section Namespaces, Prefixes and Term Names in the Audiovisual Core Term List document for discussion of the rationale for separate terms taking URI values from those taking Literal values where both are possible. Normal practice is to use the same Label if both are provided. Labels have no effect on information discovery and are only suggestions.
fields.rdfs:comment: URI of person or organization originally responsible for providing the resource metadata record.

fields.name: furtherInformationURL
fields.title: Further Information URL
fields.description: A URL of a website that provides additional information about the version of the dwc:Media resource that is provided by the Service Access Point.
fields.rdfs:comment: The URL of a Web site that provides additional information about the version of the media resource that is provided by the Service Access Point.

fields.name: feedbackURL
fields.title: Feedback URL
fields.description: A uniform resource locator (URL) that points to a webpage on which a form may be submitted to gather feedback about the record.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to optionally include query strings that act to pre-populate web page form elements and communicate the context.
fields.rdfs:comment: A uniform resource locator (URL) that points to a webpage on which a form may be submitted to gather feedback about the record.

fields.name: references
fields.title: References
fields.description: A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise pointed to by the described resource.
fields.comments: This property is intended to be used with non-literal values. This property is an inverse property of Is Referenced By.
fields.rdfs:comment: A related resource that is referenced, cited, or otherwise pointed to by the described resource.

fields.name: bibliographicCitation
fields.title: Bibliographic Citation
fields.description: A bibliographic reference for a resource.
fields.comments: From Dublin Core, 'Recommended practice is to include sufficient bibliographic detail to identify the resource as unambiguously as possible.' The intended usage of this term in Darwin Core is to provide the preferred way to cite the resource itself. Note that the intended usage of dcterms:references in Darwin Core, by contrast, is to point to the definitive source representation of the resource, if one is available.

fields.name: projectID
fields.title: Project ID
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers for projects that contributed to a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: A projectID may be shared in multiple distinct datasets. The nature of the association can be described in the metadata project description element. This term should be used to provide a globally unique identifier (GUID) for a project, if available. This could be a DOI, URI, or any other persistent identifier that ensures a project can be uniquely distinguished from others. Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.rdfs:comment: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers for projects that contributed to a dwc:Event.

fields.name: projectTitle
fields.title: Project Title
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of titles or names for projects that contributed to a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Use this term to provide the official name or title of a project as it is commonly known and cited. Avoid abbreviations unless they are widely understood. Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `Arctic Deep`; `Scalidophora i Noreg`; `The Nansen Legacy`; `Underwater Oases of the Mar del Plata Canyon: Talud Continental IV`
fields.rdfs:comment: A list (concatenated and separated) of titles or names for projects that contributed to a dwc:Event.

fields.name: usagePolicyID
fields.title: Usage Policy ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:UsagePolicy.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: rights
fields.title: Rights
fields.description: Information about rights held in and over the resource. A full-text, readable copyright statement, as required by the national legislation of the copyright holder. On collections, this applies to all contained objects, unless the object itself has a different statement. Examples: ‚ÄúCopyright XY 2008, all rights reserved‚Äù, ‚Äú¬© 2008 XY Museum‚Äù , `Public Domain.`; `Copyright unknown.` Do not place just the name of the copyright holder(s) here! That belongs in a list in the xmpRights:Owner field, which should be supplied if dc:rights is not 'Public Domain', which is appropriate only if the resource is known to be not under copyright. See also the entry for dcterms:rights in this document and see the DCMI FAQ on DC and DCTERMS Namespaces for discussion of the rationale for terms in two namespaces. Normal practice is to use the same Label if both are provided. Labels have no effect on information discovery and are only suggestions.
fields.examples: `Copyright 2014 Ron Thomas` or a URI like `http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode`
fields.rdfs:comment: Information about rights held in and over the resource. A full-text, readable copyright statement, as required by the national legislation of the copyright holder. On collections, this applies to all contained objects, unless the object itself has a different statement. Examples: ‚ÄúCopyright XY 2008, all rights reserved‚Äù, ‚Äú¬© 2008 XY Museum‚Äù , `Public Domain.`; `Copyright unknown.` Do not place just the name of the copyright holder(s) here! That belongs in a list in the xmpRights:Owner field, which should be supplied if dc:rights is not 'Public Domain', which is appropriate only if the resource is known to be not under copyright. See also the entry for dcterms:rights in this document and see the DCMI FAQ on DC and DCTERMS Namespaces for discussion of the rationale for terms in two namespaces. Normal practice is to use the same Label if both are provided. Labels have no effect on information discovery and are only suggestions.

fields.name: rightsIRI
fields.title: Rights IRI
fields.description: A URI pointing to structured information about rights held in and over the resource. Examples include http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode and http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/. At least one of dcterms:rights and dc:rights must be supplied but, when feasible, supplying both may make the metadata more widely useful. They must specify the same rights. In case of ambiguity, dcterms:rights prevails.
fields.rdfs:comment: A URI pointing to structured information about rights held in and over the resource. Examples include http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode and http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/. At least one of dcterms:rights and dc:rights must be supplied but, when feasible, supplying both may make the metadata more widely useful. They must specify the same rights. In case of ambiguity, dcterms:rights prevails.

fields.name: rightsHolder
fields.title: Rights Holder
fields.description: A name of a dcterms:Agent that owns or manages rights over a resource.
fields.rdfs:comment: A person or organization owning or managing rights over the resource.

fields.name: rightsHolderID
fields.title: Rights Holder ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dcterms:Agent that owns or manages rights over a resource.
fields.rdfs:comment: A person or organization owning or managing rights over the resource.

fields.name: owner
fields.title: Owner
fields.description: A name of a dcterms:Agent that owns the copyright for a resource.
fields.comments: `unknown`
fields.examples: `The names of the owners `Ron Thomas, Roz Thomas` or a URI that identifies the owner`
fields.rdfs:comment: A list of the names of the owners of the copyright. 'Unknown' is an acceptable value, but 'Public Domain' is not.

fields.name: ownerID
fields.title: Owner ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dcterms:Agent that owns the copyright for a resource.
fields.rdfs:comment: A list of the names of the owners of the copyright. 'Unknown' is an acceptable value, but 'Public Domain' is not.

fields.name: usageTerms
fields.title: Usage Terms
fields.description: A license statement defining how resources may be used. Information on a collection applies to all contained objects unless an object has a different statement.
fields.rdfs:comment: The license statement defining how resources may be used. Information on a collection applies to all contained objects unless the object has a different statement.

fields.name: webStatement
fields.title: Web Statement
fields.description: A URL defining or further elaborating on a license statement (e.g., a web page explaining the precise terms of use).
fields.rdfs:comment: A URL defining or further elaborating on the license statement (e. g., a web page explaining the precise terms of use).

fields.name: accessRights
fields.title: Access Rights
fields.description: Information about who can access the resource or an indication of its security status.
fields.comments: Access Rights may include information regarding access or restrictions based on privacy, security, or other policies.
fields.rdfs:comment: Information about who access the resource or an indication of its security status.

fields.name: license
fields.title: License
fields.description: A legal document giving official permission to do something with a resource.
fields.comments: Recommended practice is to identify the license document with a URI. If this is not possible or feasible, a literal value that identifies the license may be provided.
fields.rdfs:comment: A legal document giving official permission to do something with the resource.

fields.name: licenseLogoURL
fields.title: License Logo URL
fields.description: A URL providing access to a logo that symbolizes a dcterms:license.
fields.comments: The originating metadata provider is strongly urged to choose a suitable logo as a graphical representation of the license. Failure to do so may leave downstream aggregators in a difficult position to supply a logo that adequately represents the professional, legal, or social aims of the licensors (license givers). Example: http://i.creativecommons.org/l/by-nc-sa/3.0/us/88x31.png provides access to a logo image.
fields.rdfs:comment: A URL providing access to a logo that symbolizes the License.

fields.name: licensingException
fields.title: Licensing Exception
fields.description: The licensing statement for this variant of the dwc:Media resource if different from that given in the dcterms:license property of the resource.
fields.comments: Required only if this version has different licensing than that of a corresponding dwc:Media resource. For example, the highest resolution version may be more restricted than lower resolution versions.
fields.rdfs:comment: The licensing statement for this variant of the media resource if different from that given in the License Statement property of the resource.

fields.name: credit
fields.title: Credit
fields.description: Free text describing how credit should be attributed.
fields.comments: For example, `Please cite this as‚Ä¶`.
fields.rdfs:comment: Free text for `Please cite this as‚Ä¶`

fields.name: attributionLogoURL
fields.title: Attribution Logo URL
fields.description: The URL of the icon or logo image to appear in source attribution.
fields.rdfs:comment: The URL of the icon or logo image to appear in source attribution.

fields.name: attributionLinkURL
fields.title: Attribution Link URL
fields.description: The URL where information about ownership, attribution, etc. of the resource may be found.
fields.rdfs:comment: The URL where information about ownership, attribution, etc. of the resource may be found.
